meanings.definition: Forming a judgment or opinion before having all the facts
meanings.sent1: She made a prejudging comment without knowing the whole story.
meanings.sent2: It is not fair to make prejudging assumptions about people.
meanings.sent3: He realized his prejudging mistake and apologized for it.
meanings.sent4: Her prejudging attitude closed her off from new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The prejudging mindset can limit one's understanding of others.

meanings.definition: To judge or decide something before knowing all the facts
meanings.sent1: Try not to prejudge situations before you have all the information.
meanings.sent2: Prejudging can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts.
meanings.sent3: She caught herself prejudging the outcome of the game too soon.
meanings.sent4: Prejudging a book by its cover can sometimes lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: He learned the hard way that prejudging can have negative consequences.

meanings.definition: Having a negative opinion about someone or something before knowing all the facts
meanings.sent1: Her prejudging attitude made it difficult to see the good in others.
meanings.sent2: Prejudging people based on appearances is not a fair practice.
meanings.sent3: He realized his prejudging mistake and tried to make amends.
meanings.sent4: The prejudging mindset can cloud one's ability to see the truth.
meanings.sent5: Prejudging can prevent meaningful connections from forming.
